newsitem.title: ABU DHABI: UAE approves 19.86 bln dirham '97 budget.
newsitem.headline: UAE approves 19.86 bln dirham '97 budget.

text.p: The United Arab Emirates on Monday approved its 1997 federal budget, projecting spending of 19.86 billion dirhams and revenue of 18.87 billion, the official news agency WAM reported.

It said the budget, which forecast a deficit of 987 million dirhams, was approved by the cabinet. Last year's budget had projected spending of 18.25 billion dirhams and revenue of 17.40 billion in the oil-rich Gulf Arab state.
The agency did not say at what oil price the new budget was based on. The UAE is a major oil producer with an OPEC quota of 2.161 million bpd. Its annual oil income is estimated at $9 billion.
The seven emirates which make up the UAE do not release separate budgets.
Bankers estimate the country's federal budget represents only one third of real consolidated spending of all the emirates.
